column1: #Text=**Authors:** Jon Zubizarreta, Iker Aguinaga, Juan D.
#Text=DSM is a novel approach to monocular SLAM.
#Text=It is a fully direct system that estimates the camera trajectory and a consistent global map.
#Text=Is is able to detect and handle map point reobservations when revisiting already mapped areas using the same photometric model and map points.
#Text=We provide examples to run the SLAM system in the [EuRoC dataset](https://projects.asl.ethz.ch/datasets/doku.php?
#Text=We also provide an optional GUI for 3D visualization of the system results.
#Text=* Jon Zubizarreta, Iker Aguinaga and J.
#Text=We tested DSM int two different system configurations: **Ubuntu 18.04** and **Windows 10** (VS15 and VS17).
#Text=It should be easy to compile in other platforms.
#Text=We use [Eigen3](http://eigen.tuxfamily.org) for almost any mathematical operation.
#Text=We use [OpenCV](https://opencv.org/) to manipulate images (read/write/display) and to bootstrap the monocular system.
#Text=Feel free to implement those functionalities with your prefered library, if you want to get rid off Opencv.
#Text=We use [Ceres Solver](http://ceres-solver.org) to perform the photometric bundle adjustment.
#Text=In addition to the standard installation process, we generate a custom template specialization corresponding to our Schur structure, which speeds up the Schur elimination step.
#Text=This is an optional step that can be skipped.
#Text=Although Qt is required to compile the whole project in the current version, it is easy to remove it.
#Text=All the code related with Qt is in the `QtVisualizer` folder.
#Text=Feel free to implement your own version of `IVisualizer` and replace the current visualizer `QtVisualizer`.
#Text=Now we are ready to build DSM.
#Text=This will compile two libraries `libdsm.so` and `libQtVisualizer.so` at **lib** folder, which can be linked from external projects.
#Text=It will also create two executables `EurocExample` and `VideoExample` at **bin** folder to run DSM in the EuRoC dataset and with custom videos respectively.
#Text=Support for macOS is experimental and not extensively tested, but in principle DSM including the GUI should be functional.
#Text=External dependencies on macOS can be installed with [Homebrew](https://brew.sh/)
#Text=brew install cmake eigen opencv ceres-solver qt
#Text=From this point, you can follow the instructions above for *2.3 DSM build*.
#Text=**Note**: In some cases, the Qt5 installation location is not automatically found and you need to specify the modules manually to cmake with
#Text=DSM requires the geometric calibration of the camera as an input.
#Text=Currently it uses the radial-tangential model of OpenCV.
#Text=However, it should be easy to add new camera models.
#Text=fx fy cx cy k1 k2 p1 p2
#Text=It is also possible to use higher order distortion models.
#Text=You have to add the additional distortion coefficients using the OpenCV order.
#Text=If no distortion coefficients are provided, they are assumed to be zero.
#Text=Run the executable with the following arguments
#Text=   * `<IMAGE_FOLDER>` Folder containing the images of the sequence
#Text=* `<TIMESTAMPS_FILE>` File containing the image timestamps for that specific sequence
#Text=* `<CALIB_FILE>` File with the geometric calibration of the camera
#Text=If it is not provided, internal default values are used.
#Text=The `<IMAGE_FOLDER>` can be usually found in `<SEQ_FOLDER>/mav0/camX/data`, where the X indicates if the left (0) or right (1) camera is used.
#Text=The specific `<TIMESTAMPS_FILE>`, `<CALIB_FILE>` and `<SETTINGS_FILE>` for the EuRoC dataset are provided in `Examples/EurocData`.
#Text=It is also possible to run your own custom videos with known camera calibration.
#Text=   * `<VIDEO_FILE>` Custom video file with a supported format by OpenCV.
#Text=The system parameter options can be found in `settings.h`.
#Text=Those can also be loaded using an external `.txt` file, such as the one in `Examples/EurocData/settings.txt`.
#Text=* `blockUntilMapped`: blocks the tracking thread until the mapping thread finishes.
#Text=* `singleThreaded`: runs tracking and mapping sequentially in a single thread.
#Text=* `mappingThreads`: number of multithreads to parallelize the mapping.
#Text=* `minimizeMemory`: use a buffer pool for memory usage minimization.
#Text=* `useFixedHuberScale`: flag to control if a Huber loss function with a fixed scale in used.
#Text=* `huberScale`: value of the Huber loss function scale.
#Text=* `useTDistribution`: flag to control if the t-distribution is used.
#Text=When it is enabled, Huber loss is disabled.
#Text=When <= 0 it is dinamically computed, otherwise it is fixed.
#Text=When < 0 it is dinamically computer, otherwise it is fixed.
#Text=When <= 0 it is dinamically computer, otherwise it is fixed.
#Text=* `defaultNu`: default value fot the t-distribution degrees of freedom.
#Text=* `defaultMu`: default value fot the t-distribution location.
#Text=* `defaultSigma`: default value fot the t-distribution scale.
#Text=* `inlierPercentile`: percentile of inliers for energy threshold.
#Text=* `maxPixelOutlier`: maximum percentage of pixels to consider an observation as outlier.
#Text=* `maxPixelDiscard`: maximum percentage of pixels to discard an observations during optimization.
#Text=* `maxEnergyFit`: maximum energy to fit the t-distribution.
#Text=* `trackingMaxLevel`: maximum number of pyramid levels during frame tracking.
#Text=* `pointDetectionLevels`: number of pyramid levels to detect candidate points.
#Text=* `numCandidates`: number of candidate points per keyframe.
#Text=* `numBlocksPerDimension`: number of blocks per image dimension during candidate point detection.
#Text=* `minGradAdd`: threshold constant addition to histogram for candidate point detection.
#Text=* `maxUnmappedFrames`: maximum number of unmmaped frames in the queue.
#Text=* `secondBestRadius`: radius to the second best match during epipolar search.
#Text=* `subpixelIterations`: number of iterations during subpixel computation.
#Text=* `subpixelStepThreshold`: threshold to stop the subpixel optimization.
#Text=* `maxViewChange`: maximum parallax to consider a point as visible
#Text=* `candidateOptIterations`: maximum number of iterations for candidate refinement.
#Text=* `minDistToActivate`: initial minimum distance to activate new active points.
#Text=* `maxCandidateUncertainty`: maximum  candidate point uncertainty to activate it.
#Text=* `minCandidateQuality`: minimum candidate point quality (distance to second best) to activate it
#Text=* `doOnlyTemporalOpt`: use only temporally connected keyframe in the photometric bundle adjustment.
#Text=* `minOptimizationGrad`: minimum gradient to consider an observation as outlier
#Text=* `minBAIterations`: minimum number of photometric bundle adjustment iterations.
#Text=* `maxBAIterations`: maximum number of photometric bundle adjustment iterations.
#Text=* `optMaxLevel`: number of maximum levels during pyramidal photometric bundle adjustment.
#Text=* `varScaleAlpha`: light alpha scale factor during optimizations.
#Text=* `varScaleBeta`: light beta scale factor during optimizations.
#Text=* `varScaleIDepth`: inverse depth scale factor during optimization.
#Text=* `numActivePoints`: maximum number of observations in the latest keyframe.
#Text=* `maxTemporalKeyframes`: maximum number of temporal keyframes in the optimization window.
#Text=* `maxCovisibleKeyframes`: maximum number of covisible keyframes in the optimization window.
#Text=* `numAlwaysKeepKeyframes`: number of latest temporal keyframes to keep always in the optimization window.
#Text=* `minPointCovisible`: minimum ratio of visible points to consider a keyframe as covisible.
#Text=* `maxLightCovisible`: maximum light change to consider a keyframe covisible.
#Text=* `minNumKFToConsiderNew`: minimum number of keyframes to consider an active point as a new.
#Text=* `minNumGoodObservations`: minimum number of observation to consider an active point as inlier.
#Text=* `newKFDistWeight`: weight of the camera translation relative to scene depth during new keyframe selection.
#Text=* `newKFUsageWeight`: weight of the point usage by the frame tracker during new keyframe selection.
#Text=* `newKFAffineWeight`: weight of the light change in the scene during new keyframe selection.
#Text=* `newKFResidualWeight`: weight of the frame tracker residual during new keyframe selection.
#Text=* `minNumMappedFramesToCreateKF`: minimum number of tracked frames to create a new keyframe.\t
#Text=For a list of all code/library dependencies (and associated licenses), please see [Dependencies.md](https://github.com/jzubizarreta/dsm/blob/master/Dependencies.md).
#Text=For a closed-source version of DSM for commercial purposes, please contact the authors.
#Text=If you use DSM in an academic work, please cite:
#Text=      author={Zubizarreta, Jon, Aguinaga, Iker and Montiel, J.
